trans-unit.source: Azure Backup - backup and restore from a Windows Server or Windows Client
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup - backup and restore from a Windows Server or Windows Client

trans-unit.source: Learn how to backup and restore from a Windows Server or Windows Client.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to backup and restore from a Windows Server or Windows Client.

trans-unit.source: The article also covers alternate server recovery
trans-unit.target: The article also covers alternate server recovery

trans-unit.source: Back up and restore from a Windows server or Windows client machine
trans-unit.target: Back up and restore from a Windows server or Windows client machine

trans-unit.source: This article covers the steps required to back up from a Windows server or a Windows client machine.
trans-unit.target: This article covers the steps required to back up from a Windows server or a Windows client machine.

trans-unit.source: It also covers the steps required to restore the backed up files on the same machine and the steps required to restore the backed up files on any other machine.
trans-unit.target: It also covers the steps required to restore the backed up files on the same machine and the steps required to restore the backed up files on any other machine.

trans-unit.source: Backup files
trans-unit.target: Backup files

trans-unit.source: Once the machine is registered, open the Microsoft Azure Backup mmc snap-in.
trans-unit.target: Once the machine is registered, open the Microsoft Azure Backup mmc snap-in.

trans-unit.source: Search result
trans-unit.target: Search result

trans-unit.source: Click on **Schedule Backup**
trans-unit.target: Click on **Schedule Backup**

trans-unit.source: Schedule Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule Backup

trans-unit.source: Select the items which you wish to back up.
trans-unit.target: Select the items which you wish to back up.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup on a Windows Server/Windows Client (i.e
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup on a Windows Server/Windows Client (i.e

trans-unit.source: without System Center Data Protection Manager) enables you to protect files and folders.
trans-unit.target: without System Center Data Protection Manager) enables you to protect files and folders.

trans-unit.source: Items to Backup
trans-unit.target: Items to Backup

trans-unit.source: Specify the backup schedule and retention policy which is explained in detail in the following [article](backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape.md)
trans-unit.target: Specify the backup schedule and retention policy which is explained in detail in the following [article](backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape.md)

trans-unit.source: Choose the method of sending the initial backup.
trans-unit.target: Choose the method of sending the initial backup.

trans-unit.source: Your choice of completing the initial seeding is dependent on the amount of data you wish to back up and your internet upload link speed.
trans-unit.target: Your choice of completing the initial seeding is dependent on the amount of data you wish to back up and your internet upload link speed.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to back up GB’s/TB’s of data over a high latency, low bandwidth connection, it is recommended that you complete the initial backup by shipping a disk to the nearest Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to back up GB’s/TB’s of data over a high latency, low bandwidth connection, it is recommended that you complete the initial backup by shipping a disk to the nearest Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: This is called “Offline Backup” and is covered in detail in this [article](backup-azure-backup-import-export.md).
trans-unit.target: This is called “Offline Backup” and is covered in detail in this [article](backup-azure-backup-import-export.md).

trans-unit.source: If you have a sufficient bandwidth connection we recommend that you complete the initial backup over the network.
trans-unit.target: If you have a sufficient bandwidth connection we recommend that you complete the initial backup over the network.

trans-unit.source: Initial Backup
trans-unit.target: Initial Backup

trans-unit.source: Once the process completes, go back to the mmc snap in and click **Back up Now** to complete the initial seeding over the network.
trans-unit.target: Once the process completes, go back to the mmc snap in and click **Back up Now** to complete the initial seeding over the network.

trans-unit.source: Backup now
trans-unit.target: Backup now

trans-unit.source: Once the initial seeding is completed, the **Jobs** view in the Azure Backup console indicates the status.
trans-unit.target: Once the initial seeding is completed, the **Jobs** view in the Azure Backup console indicates the status.

trans-unit.source: IR complete
trans-unit.target: IR complete

trans-unit.source: Recover data on the same machine
trans-unit.target: Recover data on the same machine

trans-unit.source: If you accidentally deleted a file and wish to restore the file/volume on the same machine (from which the backup is taken), the following steps will help you recover the data.
trans-unit.target: If you accidentally deleted a file and wish to restore the file/volume on the same machine (from which the backup is taken), the following steps will help you recover the data.

trans-unit.source: Open the **Microsoft Azure Backup** snap in.
trans-unit.target: Open the **Microsoft Azure Backup** snap in.

trans-unit.source: Click **Recover Data** to initiate the workflow.
trans-unit.target: Click **Recover Data** to initiate the workflow.

trans-unit.source: Recover Data
trans-unit.target: Recover Data

trans-unit.source: Select **This server (*yourmachinename*)** option as you plan to restore the backed up file on the same machine.
trans-unit.target: Select **This server (*yourmachinename*)** option as you plan to restore the backed up file on the same machine.

trans-unit.source: Same machine
trans-unit.target: Same machine

trans-unit.source: You can choose to **Browse for files** or **Search for files**.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to **Browse for files** or **Search for files**.

trans-unit.source: Leave the default option if you plan to restore one or more files whose path is known.
trans-unit.target: Leave the default option if you plan to restore one or more files whose path is known.

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure about the folder structure but would like to search for a file, pick the **Search for files** option.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure about the folder structure but would like to search for a file, pick the **Search for files** option.

trans-unit.source: For the purpose of this section, we will proceed with the default option.
trans-unit.target: For the purpose of this section, we will proceed with the default option.

trans-unit.source: Browse files
trans-unit.target: Browse files

trans-unit.source: Select the volume from which you wish to restore the file.
trans-unit.target: Select the volume from which you wish to restore the file.

trans-unit.source: The screen enables you restore from any point in time.
trans-unit.target: The screen enables you restore from any point in time.

trans-unit.source: Dates which appear in **bold** in the calendar control indicate the availability of a restore point.
trans-unit.target: Dates which appear in **bold** in the calendar control indicate the availability of a restore point.

trans-unit.source: Once a date is selected, based on your backup schedule (and the success of a backup operation), you can select a point in time from the **Time** drop down.
trans-unit.target: Once a date is selected, based on your backup schedule (and the success of a backup operation), you can select a point in time from the **Time** drop down.

trans-unit.source: Volume and Date
trans-unit.target: Volume and Date

trans-unit.source: Select the items you wish to recover.
trans-unit.target: Select the items you wish to recover.

trans-unit.source: You can multi-select folders/files which you wish to restore.
trans-unit.target: You can multi-select folders/files which you wish to restore.

trans-unit.source: Select files
trans-unit.target: Select files

trans-unit.source: Specify the recovery parameters.
trans-unit.target: Specify the recovery parameters.

trans-unit.source: Recovery options
trans-unit.target: Recovery options

trans-unit.source: You have an option of restoring to the original location (in which the file/folder would be overwritten) or to another location in the same machine.
trans-unit.target: You have an option of restoring to the original location (in which the file/folder would be overwritten) or to another location in the same machine.

trans-unit.source: If the file/folder which you wish to restore, exists in the target location, you have the option to either create copies (two versions of the same file), or overwrite the files in the target location or skip the recovery of the files which exist in the target.
trans-unit.target: If the file/folder which you wish to restore, exists in the target location, you have the option to either create copies (two versions of the same file), or overwrite the files in the target location or skip the recovery of the files which exist in the target.

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended that you leave the default option of restoring the ACLs on the files which are being recovered.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended that you leave the default option of restoring the ACLs on the files which are being recovered.

trans-unit.source: Once these inputs are provided, the recovery workflow starts which restores the files to this machine.
trans-unit.target: Once these inputs are provided, the recovery workflow starts which restores the files to this machine.

trans-unit.source: Recover to an alternate machine
trans-unit.target: Recover to an alternate machine

trans-unit.source: If your entire server is lost, you can still recover the file/volume in a different machine.
trans-unit.target: If your entire server is lost, you can still recover the file/volume in a different machine.

trans-unit.source: The following steps illustrate the workflow.
trans-unit.target: The following steps illustrate the workflow.

trans-unit.source: The nomenclature used in the steps are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The nomenclature used in the steps are as follows:

trans-unit.source: *Source machine* – The original machine from which the backup was taken and which is currently unavailable.
trans-unit.target: *Source machine* – The original machine from which the backup was taken and which is currently unavailable.

trans-unit.source: *Target machine* – The machine on which the data is being retrieved.
trans-unit.target: *Target machine* – The machine on which the data is being retrieved.

trans-unit.source: *Sample vault* – The Backup vault to which the *Source machine* and *Target machine* are registered.
trans-unit.target: *Sample vault* – The Backup vault to which the *Source machine* and *Target machine* are registered.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Backups taken from a machine cannot be restored on a machine which is running an earlier version of the operating system.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Backups taken from a machine cannot be restored on a machine which is running an earlier version of the operating system.

trans-unit.source: For example, if backups are taken from a Windows 7 machine, it can be restored on a Windows 8 or above machine.
trans-unit.target: For example, if backups are taken from a Windows 7 machine, it can be restored on a Windows 8 or above machine.

trans-unit.source: However the vice-versa does not hold true.
trans-unit.target: However the vice-versa does not hold true.

trans-unit.source: Open the **Microsoft Azure Backup** snap in the *Target machine*.
trans-unit.target: Open the **Microsoft Azure Backup** snap in the *Target machine*.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the *Target machine* and the *Source machine* are restored to the same backup vault.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the *Target machine* and the *Source machine* are restored to the same backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Click **Recover Data** to initiate the workflow.
trans-unit.target: Click **Recover Data** to initiate the workflow.

trans-unit.source: Recover Data
trans-unit.target: Recover Data

trans-unit.source: Select **Another server**
trans-unit.target: Select **Another server**

trans-unit.source: Another Server
trans-unit.target: Another Server

trans-unit.source: Provide the vault credential file which corresponds to the *Sample vault*.
trans-unit.target: Provide the vault credential file which corresponds to the *Sample vault*.

trans-unit.source: If the vault credential file is invalid (or expired), download a new vault credential file from the *Sample vault* in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: If the vault credential file is invalid (or expired), download a new vault credential file from the *Sample vault* in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Once the vault credential file is provided, the backup vault against the vault credential file is displayed.
trans-unit.target: Once the vault credential file is provided, the backup vault against the vault credential file is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select the *Source machine* from the list of displayed machines.
trans-unit.target: Select the *Source machine* from the list of displayed machines.

trans-unit.source: List of machines
trans-unit.target: List of machines

trans-unit.source: As before, select either the **Search for files** or **Browse for files** option.
trans-unit.target: As before, select either the **Search for files** or **Browse for files** option.

trans-unit.source: For the purpose of this section, we will use the **Search for files** option.
trans-unit.target: For the purpose of this section, we will use the **Search for files** option.

trans-unit.source: Search
trans-unit.target: Search

trans-unit.source: Select the volume and date in the next screen.
trans-unit.target: Select the volume and date in the next screen.

trans-unit.source: Search for the folder/file name you wish to restore.
trans-unit.target: Search for the folder/file name you wish to restore.

trans-unit.source: Search items
trans-unit.target: Search items

trans-unit.source: Select the location to which the files need to be restored.
trans-unit.target: Select the location to which the files need to be restored.

trans-unit.source: Restore location
trans-unit.target: Restore location

trans-unit.source: Provide the encryption passphrase that was provided during *Source machine’s* registration to *Sample vault*.
trans-unit.target: Provide the encryption passphrase that was provided during *Source machine’s* registration to *Sample vault*.

trans-unit.source: Encryption
trans-unit.target: Encryption

trans-unit.source: Once the input is provided, click on the **Recover** button which triggers the restore of the backed up files in the destination provided.
trans-unit.target: Once the input is provided, click on the **Recover** button which triggers the restore of the backed up files in the destination provided.

trans-unit.source: Video walkthrough
trans-unit.target: Video walkthrough

trans-unit.source: Here's a video walkthrough of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Here's a video walkthrough of this tutorial.

trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.target: Azure Backup FAQ

trans-unit.target: test
